intro: Laugeria lineolata, commonly known as the lineolate fern, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
